alert.note: Alert for Baker County; Malheur County; Oregon Lower Treasure Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 3:24PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Washington, south central Baker and northeastern Malheur Counties through 500 PM MDT/400 PM PDT/... At 424 PM MDT/324 PM PDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Huntington, or 15 miles west of Weiser, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Henley Basin and Indian Head Mountain around 430 PM MDT. Weiser and Annex around 440 PM MDT. Mann Creek Reservoir and Mann Creek Guard Station around 450 PM MDT. Star Butte, Midvale Hill, Midvale and Presley Bridge around 500 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Baker County; Malheur County; Oregon Lower Treasure Valley
